attributes.action: Stop the SNP voting on Brexit and any UK law until Indie ref 2 is removed
attributes.additional_details:
SNP - 35 seats 
Their Brexit strategy is to revoke or extend article 50.
They have made a promise to vote down any conservative policy as per their Brexit policy published. 
Scotland was previously a labour held territory until the SNP began to grow on the back of the recession.
In 2014 55% voted not to leave the UK which was a greater % than the Brexit vote yet the SNP are insitant another vote is required.
attributes.background: The SNP claim to have a mandate to hold a second Scottish independence referendum by 2021, in turn breaking up the UK union. How can we accept the SNP voting on Brexit, and UK law when their main objective is to leave the UK! The future UK needs a strong union not one full of in house uncertainty.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because it's not clear what you mean by "until indie ref 2 is removed". In any case, it's not the responsibility of the UK Government or Parliament to stop some MPs from voting because of their political views.
